summary: This is an internal email from July 1, 2020, discussing victim notification procedures following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest. It outlines plans to send different notification letters to statutory victims (those named in the indictment) and non-statutory victims (other identified victims of Epstein).

events.title: Victim Notification Planning
events.description: Internal email correspondence discussing plans to notify victims following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, including drafting separate letters for statutory and non-statutory victims.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email dated July 1, 2020, regarding victim notification procedures.
It distinguishes between 'statutory victims' (those identified in the Maxwell indictment) and 'non-statutory victims' (other individuals identified as Epstein victims).
Plans include sending a drafted notification letter to non-statutory victims following Maxwell's arrest.
For the three statutory victims, standard victim notification letters would be sent, and AUSAs would call their attorneys.
The document indicates coordination was occurring around the time of Maxwell's arrest regarding victim outreach.
